parts.name: add
parts.description: Finds the sum of two numbers.

params.name: number1
params.description: Number to be added to `number2`.

params.name: number2
params.description: Number to be added to `number1`.

return.description: If `number1` and `number2` are given the sum of the two will be returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one number and will return the number passed to the partial function added to `number1`.

parts.name: after
parts.description: Finds the substring after a specific target.

params.name: subject
params.description: The string to search.

params.name: target
params.description: The target to find and key off of within `subject`.

params.name: opt_occurrence
params.description: The occurrence of `target` that you want to key off of within `subject`. If negative, the occurrence will be counted from the end of `subject`.

return.description: Returns the string found after `target`. If `target` was not found or the specified occurrence (`opt_occurrence`) of `target` was not found, `null` will be returned.

parts.name: afterAll
parts.description: Calls a function after all of the objects in an array have had an action carried out.

params.name: objects
params.description: Array of objects for which a function is sure to be called.

params.name: binder
params.description: If this is a function it will be called for each object in `objects` and will be passed (1) a function that is to be called when action is to be taken (eg. on an event), (2) an object from `objects` and (3) the corresponding index of that object from `objects`.  Call If this is an array of strings the strings will be treated as event names that will be listened to.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function to be called once either action was taken for all of the objects in `objects`.  If `binder` is an array of strings this means once at least one of the events was called for each object in `objects`.  This function will be called with (1) a copy of `objects` and (2) an array of objects that will have a `arguments` property containing the arguments passed when the action was taken and a `timeStamp` property containing the epoch value of when the action was taken.  The objects in the second argument passed will always correspond to the objects in the first argument.

return.description: Returns an array of booleans each one indicating if the corresponding object from `objects` has had an action take place.

parts.name: alias
parts.code: function alias(context, name) { return context[name].bind(context); }
parts.description: Binds a context to a given function within that context.

params.name: context
params.description: Context object containing the function to be called.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the function to call within the context.

return.description: Function that when called will execute the function with the given name under the given context.

parts.name: andBits
parts.description: Finds the bitwise `and` of two numbers.

params.name: number1
params.description: Number to be `and`ed against `number2`.

params.name: number2
params.description: Number to be `and`ed against `number1`.

return.description: If `number1` and `number2` are given a bitwise `and` will be executed on both and returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one number and will return a number which is the result of using bitwise `and` on `number1` and the number passed to this partial function.

parts.name: around
parts.description: Gets the substrings around a specific target.

params.name: subject
params.description: The string to search.

params.name: target
params.description: The target to find and key off of within `subject`.

params.name: opt_occurrence
params.description: The occurrence of `target` that you want to key off of within `subject`. If negative, the occurrence will be counted from the end of `subject`.

return.description: Returns an array with two values: the string found before `target` and the string found after `target`. If `target` was not found or the specified occurrence (`opt_occurrence`) of `target` was not found, `[null, null]` will be returned.

parts.name: array
parts.description: Creates a new array with the given length and fills the array with the given value.

params.name: length
params.description: Integer that represents the length of the array (minimum of 0).

params.name: opt_filler
params.description: Either a filler value or if this is a function and `opt_callFiller` is `true`-ish then this function will be called with the index to be filled and the return value will be used as the value added at that index.

params.name: opt_callFiller
params.description: If specified as `true`-ish and `opt_filler` is a function then `opt_filler` will be called as a function to generate the values at for each item in the new array.

return.description: A new array of the specified length with the specified value used for each item.

tests.name: Simple
tests.code: test(JSON.stringify(YourJS.array(10, function(x) { return x * x; }, true)), '[0,1,4,9,16,25,36,49,64,81]');

parts.name: attempt
parts.description: Attempts to call a function if one exists at the given path starting at the given root object.

params.name: root
params.description: The root object for which to begin traversing the `path` the find the corresponding function to be called.

params.name: path
params.description: If this is a string it represents the name of `root`'s function that will be called.  If this is an array it represents a path to the object and then the underlying function that will be called.

params.name: opt_argX
params.description: Zero or more arguments to be passed to the function at `path`.

return.description: If there is a function found at `path` under root it will be executed and the return value will be returned.  Otherwise `undefined` is returned.

parts.name: avg
parts.description: Finds the average of the number in an array.

params.name: array
params.description: Array of numbers for which to find the average.

return.description: The average of the numbers in `array`.

parts.name: before
parts.description: Finds the substring before a specific target.

params.name: subject
params.description: The string to search.

params.name: target
params.description: The target to find and key off of within `subject`.

params.name: opt_occurrence
params.description: The occurrence of `target` that you want to key off of within `subject`. If negative, the occurrence will be counted from the end of `subject`.

return.description: Returns the string found before `target`. If `target` was not found or the specified occurrence (`opt_occurrence`) of `target` was not found, `null` will be returned.

parts.name: best
parts.description: Gives the best item in a list based on the return value of the given iterator function.

params.name: array
params.description: Either the array to be iterated over to find the best value or `undefined` (or `null`) indicating that this is a partial function call.

params.name: iterator
params.description: Function that will receive two values starting with the first two in `array` or in the array passed when calling the returned partial function.  When a `true`-ish is returned by this function the value in `array` passed as the first argument will be regarded as the best value, otherwise the value in `array` passed as the second argument will be regarded as the best value.

return.description: If `array` is `undefined` or `null` a partial function that is simply awaiting the value of `array` will be returned. Otherwise the value that was determined to be the best will be returned.

tests.name: Shortest & Longest

parts.name: bind
parts.description: Creates a function that when called will call `fn` with `this` referring to `objThis` and any values in `opt_args` be passed as the first arguments to `fn`.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to invoke when the return function is called.

params.name: objThis
params.description: The value to which `this` will refer unless `undefined` or `null` is given.

params.name: opt_args
params.description: Array of arguments to prepend to the arguments passed to `fn` when the returned function is called.

return.description: A function that when called will call `fn` with `this` referring to `objThis` and any values in `opt_args` be passed as the first arguments to `fn`.

tests.name: Simple
tests.code:
var result = YourJS.bind(function(a, b) { return [b,a,this,a,b]; }, 1, [2])(3);
test(result.join(','), '3,2,1,2,3');

parts.name: bindCompare
parts.description: Creates a compare function which binds the namespaces within the two given objects.

params.name: namespaces
params.description: An array of namespaces to compare.  Each namespace can be an array of strings and/or numbers, a string or a number.  The order of the namespaces will determine the order in which the comparison occurs.

params.name: opt_negate
params.description: Specifies whether or not the comparison value should be negated.

return.description: A comparison function with the namespaces to be checked bound within the function.

parts.name: call
parts.description: Calls a function whether it be a global prototype function or a YourJS function or a custom bindable.

params.name: fn
params.description: If a function is supplied it will be called.  If a string, it can refer to a prototype function by using either the `"Array.prototype.slice"` (`"Prototype_Name.prototype.function_name"`) format, the `"Array#slice"` (`"Prototype_Name#function_name"`) format or the `"#slice"` (`"#function_name"` for `objThis`) format.  If not in the previous format but is a string it must be the string name of a function in the `YourJS` object.

params.name: objThis
params.description: If `fn` is a function or is a string referring to a prototypal function, this will be the value passed as the `this` object to `fn`.

params.name: argX
params.description: Arguments to pass to `fn`.

return.description: Return value of calling `fn` with the specified arguments and using the specified context object.

tests.name: Call YourJS.typeOf function (since it is required)
Call slice on string

parts.name: calls
parts.description: Makes multiple calls using the YourJS `call()` function.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to start off with in the calling chain.

params.name: callArgs
params.description: If any of these arguments are strings or functions that will be wrapped in arrays.  The items in each array argument will be passed as arguments to YourJS's `call()` function.

return.description: Return value of making the specified calls to YourJS's call function in the specified sequence.

parts.name: canDefault
parts.description: Determines whether or not a value would be defaulted to another value.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to test out.

params.name: opt_beStrict
params.description: Specifies whether or not to only check if `value` is `undefined`.

return.description: If `opt_beStrict` is `true`-ish and `value` is `undefined`, `true` will be returned.  If `opt_beStrict` is `false`-ish and `value` is `undefined`, `null` or `NaN`, `true` will be returned.  In all other cases `false` will be returned.

parts.name: cap
parts.description: Puts a cap (limit) on the amount of arguments that a function can receive.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function that will be called by the capped function.  If a string it be interpreted as the function within the YourJS object's context with that name.

params.name: opt_maxArity
params.description: The max number of arguments that will be accepted by the returned capped function.

params.name: opt_staticArgs
params.description: Arguments that will always be passed to `fn`.

params.name: opt_indexInArgs
params.description: Position within `opt_staticArgs` to place the limited additional arguments if any are passed to the capped function.  Negative position will be counted from the end of `opt_staticArgs`.

return.description: Returns a function that will call `fn` with the passed in arguments when invoked, but it will limit the argument count to the value `opt_maxArity`.

tests.name: Generic Slice

parts.name: capProto
parts.description: Creates a wrapper function for a prototype function that can be capped (limited in the amount of arguments it can receive).

params.name: fn
params.description: The prototype function that will be called by the returned wrapper function.  If it is a string it can refer to a prototype function by using either the `"Array.prototype.slice"` (`"Prototype_Name.prototype.function_name"`) format, the `"Array#slice"` (`"Prototype_Name#function_name"`) format or the `"#slice"` (`"#function_name"` for the 1st argument) format.

params.name: opt_maxArity
params.description: The max number of arguments that will be accepted by the returned capped function.

params.name: opt_staticArgs
params.description: Arguments that will always be passed to `fn`.

params.name: opt_indexInArgs
params.description: Position within `opt_staticArgs` to place the limited additional arguments if any are passed to the capped function.  Negative position will be counted from the end of `opt_staticArgs`.

return.description: Returns a function that will call `fn` with the passed in arguments when invoked, but it will limit the argument count to the value `opt_maxArity` (not including the 1st argument which is the context argument).

parts.name: cbrt
parts.description: Gets the cube root of a number.

params.name: x
params.description: A number.

return.description: The cube root of the given number.

parts.name: ceil
parts.description: Rounds towards `Infinity` with the specified precision.

params.name: num
params.description: The number to be rounded towards `Infinity`.

params.name: opt_precision
params.description: The precision (as an integer) with which to round the number towards `Infinity`. Using the precision is similar to doing `Math.ceil(num * Math.pow(10, precision)) / Math.pow(10, precision)`.

return.description: Returns `num` rounded towards `-Infinity` with the specified precision.

parts.name: chain
parts.description: Creates a chained version of a value.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to make chainable.

return.description: A `YourJSChain` object allows for chaining other YourJS functions calls together and thusly all of its functions except the `value()` function will return a `YourJSChain` object.  You can call the `YourJSChain`'s `value()` function to return the actual internal value.  The `YourJSChain`'s `end()` function will return the previous `YourJSChain` object.

parts.name: chunk
parts.description: Takes an array, splits it up into chunks of a specified size and returns a new array containing said array chunks.

params.name: array
params.description: The array that will be used to make the chunks.  This array will not be modified.

params.name: opt_chunkLimit
params.description: The maximum number of items in each chunk.  All chunks will contain this amount of items with the exception of the final chunk.

return.description: An array of arrays where each subarray contains a chunk of the values from `array`.

parts.name: clamp
parts.description: Confine a given number to a specific range.

params.name: x
params.description: The number to be confined to the specified range.

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum number that can be returned.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum number that can be returned.

return.description: The closest number to `x` that is greater than or equal to `min` and less than or equal to `max`.

parts.name: closestMultOf
parts.description: Finds the closest multiple of a number to another number.

params.name: factor
params.description: The number to find a multiple of.

params.name: target
params.description: The number that the multiple of `factor` should approximate.

return.description: A multiple of `factor` that approximates `target`.  If `factor` is 0 or not a number, `NaN` will be returned.

parts.name: commaNumber
parts.description: Turns a number into a string in its fullest form with commas separating the integral part at the thousands mark, millions mark, billions mark, etc.

params.name: num
params.description: Number that will be converted to a string and will have commas added to it to separate the hundreds from thousands, the thousands from the millions, etc.

return.description: A string representation of `num` with commas separating the hundreds from thousands, the thousands from the millions, etc.  If `num` is not a finite number `undefined` will be returned.

parts.name: compact
parts.description: Create a new array with all of the `false`-ish values removed.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array of values to comb through.

return.description: A new array with only the non-`false`-ish (not `false`, `undefined`, `null`, `""`, `0`, etc.) values found in `arr`.

parts.name: compare
parts.description: Simple compare function typically use in sorting.

params.name: a
params.description: First argument to compare.

params.name: b
params.description: Second argument to compare.

return.description: `-1` is returned if `a < b`.  `1` is returned if `a > b`.  In all other cases `0` is returned.

parts.name: compareTitle
parts.description: Compares 2 titles by splitting the titles into sections where each section is either full of digits or non-digits.

params.name: title1
params.description: First title to compare to `title2`.

params.name: title2
params.description: Second title to compare to `title1`.

return.description: If `title1` comes before `title2` a negative number will be returned.  If `title1` comes after `title2` a positive number will be returned.  In all other cases `0` will be returned.

parts.name: compose
parts.description: Create a new function which is basically the composition of two functions.

params.name: fnWrapper
params.description: Function that will be passed the return value of `fnToWrap` and whose return value will be returned by the composed function.

params.name: fnToWrap
params.description: Function that will be called 1st by te composed function and whose return value will be passed to `fnWrapper`.

params.name: opt_applyArgs
params.description: Set to `true` if the return value from `fnToWrap` is an `Array` and each element should be passed a separate argument to `fnWrapper`.  Leave blank or set to `false` if the return value from `fnToWrap` should just be passed as the 1st argument to `fnWrapper`.

return.description: The function that is composed of `fnToWrap` and `fnWrapper`.

parts.name: construct
parts.description: Constructs an object with an arbitrary number of arguments passed via an array (or an array-like object).

params.name: constructor
params.description: The constructor function.

params.name: args
params.description: Zero or more arguments with which `constructor` will be used to construct the desired object type.

return.description: Returns the result of calling `new constructor(...args)`.

parts.name: copyProps
parts.description: Copies the specified properties from the source object to the target object.

params.name: target
params.description: Target object to which the properties will be copied.

params.name: source
params.description: Source object from which the properties will be copied.

params.name: keys
params.description: Array of keys for the properties that should be copied from source to target.

params.name: opt_dontDelete
params.description: Indicates whether properties that dont exist should be deleted between objects.  If `true`, non-existent properties will be set to `undefined`.

return.description: Returns a reference to `target`.

tests.name: Simple
Simple dont delete

parts.name: copySign
parts.description: Takes the sign of the number from the second argument and uses it as the sign of the number given in the first argument.

params.name: number1
params.description: The number that will be returned with the sign specified by `number2`.

params.name: number2
params.description: The number that has the sign (positive or negative) to use as the sign for `number1` when it is returned from this function.

return.description: `number1` will be returned but with the same sign (positive or negative) as the one specified for `number2`.

parts.name: cos
parts.description: Determines the cosine of a given number either in radians or in degrees.

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle whose cosine value should be returned.

params.name: opt_usingDegrees
params.description: If `true` then `angle` will be interpreted in degrees, otherwise `angle` will be interpreted in radians.

return.description: The cosine of `angle` in radians by default, but if `opt_usingDegrees` is a `true`-ish value then the cosine of `angle` in degrees will be returned.

parts.name: cot
parts.description: Determines the cotangent of a given number either in radians or in degrees.

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle whose cotangent value should be returned.

params.name: opt_usingDegrees
params.description: If `true` then `angle` will be interpreted in degrees, otherwise `angle` will be interpreted in radians.

return.description: The cotangent of `angle` in radians by default, but if `opt_usingDegrees` is a `true`-ish value then the cotangent of `angle` in degrees will be returned.

parts.name: count
parts.description: Count how many items in an array or an object pass a given tester function.

params.name: arrOrObj
params.description: If this is an array or an object all of the items that pass the `tester` function will be counted.  If this is a string all of the characters that pass the `tester` function will be counted.

params.name: tester
params.description: Function that will take in (1) each value, (2) the corresponding key, and (3) a reference to `arrOrObj`.  If the function returns a `true`-ish value the count will be incremented.

params.name: opt_traverseAll
params.description: Indicates whether or not all items, including the non-owned ones, should be traversed and included in the count.

return.description: The number of times `tester` returned a `true`-ish value.

parts.name: countBy
parts.description: Creates or augments an object, making new properties that correspond to values in the given array.  Each property added will indicate how many items in the array corresponding to those property names.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array or array-like object containing items to group together and count.

params.name: grouper
params.description: If a function, it will be passed a value which will be used to group the items in `arr`.  If an array or a string it will be seen as the path within each item in `arr` to the property by which to group each item.

params.name: opt_initial
params.description: Object to augment with property names that will contain counts of how many items correspond to the values returned by `grouper`.

return.description: `opt_initial` with property names that will contain counts of how many items correspond to the values returned by `grouper`.

tests.name: Odds & Evens

parts.name: csc
parts.description: Determines the cosecant of a given number either in radians or in degrees.

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle whose cosecant value should be returned.

params.name: opt_usingDegrees
params.description: If `true` then `angle` will be interpreted in degrees, otherwise `angle` will be interpreted in radians.

return.description: The cosecant of `angle` in radians by default, but if `opt_usingDegrees` is a `true`-ish value then the cosecant of `angle` in degrees will be returned.

parts.name: css
parts.description: Creates a CSS stylesheet from an JSON representation of a stylesheet.

params.name: objStyles
params.description: An object representing the CSS rules to be inserted into the document. Property names will be used as media queries if they start with `"@media "`. Property names will be used as rule selectors if the value is an object. If a property name is to be used as a selector, if any selectors don't contain `&`, `"& "` will be prepended to it. For all selectors, `&` will be replaced recursively with the selectors found in the parent. CSS property names will be uncamelcased by inserting dashes before each uppercased character and lower casing all characters. If a value is `null` or `undefined`, it will be turned into `"none"`. If a value is a number other than `0`, `"px"` will be appended to it. If a value is an array all of the items will be concatenated together, using `","` to delimit the values. If a value ends with `!` it will be replaced with `"!important"`.

params.name: opt_ancestors
params.description: This can be an element or an array of elements which will get another class added to target all rules to it and its children. This can alternatively be a CSS path (selector) specifying the root on which all CSS rules created should be based.

return.description: The stylesheet that is created and appended to the document is returned.

parts.name: curry
parts.description: Creates a wrapper function that will only execute the given function once the number of arguments passed is at least a given amount.  If the wrapper is called with too few arguments, those arguments will be recursively stored within a new wrapper function.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to be executed once enough arguments have been passed.

params.name: opt_argsNeeded
params.description: Number of arguments needed to successfully invoke this function.

params.name: opt_curryRight
params.description: Indicates whether returned partial functions will group the arguments recursively from right-to-left.

params.name: opt_presetArgs
params.description: Arguments that will always be passed to `fn`.  If `opt_curryRight` is `true` any arguments passed to the wrapper function will precede these arguments when invoking the function, otherwise any arguments passed to the wrapper function will come after these arguments when invoking the function.

return.description: A wrapper function that will recursively create wrapper functions upon invocation until the cumulative number of arguments (excluding those specified in `opt_presetArgs`) amounts to `opt_argsNeeded`.  If the minimum number of arguments are passed to this function it will invoke `fn` with all of the arguments passed in.

tests.name: Wait for 5 curryRight
tests.code:
var waitFor5 = YourJS.curry(function(a,b,c,d,e){return [].join.call(arguments, ',')}, undefined, true);
test(waitFor5(4,5)(6)(7)(8,9), '8,9,7,6,4,5');

tests.name: Wait for 5 prefilled curryRight
tests.code:
var waitFor5 = YourJS.curry(function(a,b,c,d,e){return [].join.call(arguments, ',')}, undefined, true, [1,2,3]);
test(waitFor5(4)(5,6,7), '5,6,7,4,1,2,3');

parts.name: cut
parts.description: Cut out a substring within a given range.

params.name: str
params.description: String to cut from.

params.name: startIndex
params.description: Index within `str` where the substring that will be removed starts.

params.name: opt_endIndex
params.description: Index within `str` where the substring that will be removed ends.

return.description: `str` without the cut substring found between `startIndex` and `opt_endIndex`.

parts.name: debounce
parts.description: Creates a debounced copy of the function which when called will delay the execution until the specified amount of milliseconds have elapsed since the last time it ran.

params.name: fnCallback
params.description: The function to debounce. The context and parameters sent to the debounced function will be sent to this function.

params.name: msBetweenCalls
params.description: The amount of milliseconds that must pass since the last call to this function before `fnCallback` will be invoked.

params.name: opt_immediate
params.description: Specify `true` if the debounce function should run immediately instead of initially waiting for the delay. If `true` is specified, when the debounced function runs, if the delay has elapsed, the value returned from the debounced function will be that which was returned by `fnCallback`.

return.description: The debounced copy of `fnCallback`.

parts.name: deburr
parts.description: Converts supplementary latin letters into basic latin letters, removing the diacritical marks.

params.name: str

parts.name: defaulter
parts.description: Creates a partial function which will always default to another value when non-values are passed to it.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: Value to default to if the value passed to the partial function is not sufficient.

params.name: opt_beStrict
params.description: Specifies whether or not to only check if the value passed to the partial function is `undefined`.

return.description: A partial function which will return either the value passed in or `defaultValue` based on the following criteria:  If `opt_beStrict` is `true`-ish and `value` is `undefined`, `defaultValue` will be returned.  If `opt_beStrict` is `false`-ish and `value` is `undefined`, `null` or `NaN`, `defaultValue` will be returned.  In all other cases `value` will be returned.

parts.description: Defaults specific non-values to another given value.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to test out.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: Value to default to if `value` is not sufficient.

params.name: opt_beStrict
params.description: Specifies whether or not to only check if `value` is `undefined`.

return.description: If `opt_beStrict` is `true`-ish and `value` is `undefined`, `defaultValue` will be returned.  If `opt_beStrict` is `false`-ish and `value` is `undefined`, `null` or `NaN`, `defaultValue` will be returned.  In all other cases `value` will be returned.

parts.name: defer
parts.description: Defers calling a function until the current call stack is done.  Similar to using the global `setTimeout` function.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function whose call will be deferred until after all other calls in the current stack are done.

params.name: opt_args
params.description: Array of the arguments to be passed to `fn`.

return.description: The `timeoutID` associated with the deferred call.  If passed to the global `clearTimeout` while the function is being deferred the deferred function will not be called.

tests.name: Check deferred change in 100ms

parts.name: degrees
parts.description: Converts radians to degrees.

params.name: radians
params.description: The number representing radians of in angle which will be converted to degrees.

return.description: The equivalent of `radians` in degrees.

parts.name: delay
parts.description: Calls a function after a given amount of time.  This is very similar to the global `setTimeout` function.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to call after a certain amount of time.

params.name: msDelay
params.description: Delay in milliseconds before `fn` is actually called.

params.name: opt_args
params.description: An array of the arguments to pass to `fn`.

return.description: The `timeoutID` corresponding to this delayed function call.  The global `clearTimeout` function can be used to cancel this delayed call.

tests.name: Delay call

parts.name: deleteAt
parts.description: Tries to delete the value at the specified `path` starting at `root`.

params.name: root
params.description: Root object at which the `path` to delete from will start.

params.name: path
params.description: Array of numbers/strings that represents the path to the value that should be deleted.

return.description: `true` if the value can be deleted from the specified `path` under `root`, otherwise `false`.

parts.name: deleteKeys
parts.description: Deletes one or more keys from an object of some sort.

params.name: obj
params.description: If `undefined` or `null`, a partial function waiting for this value will be returned.  Otherwise this will be the object from which the specified keys will be deleted.

params.name: keys
params.description: Array of keys to be deleted from `obj`.

return.description: If `obj` is `undefined` or `null` this will be a partial function which will simply accept the given `obj`.  The return value of the partial function is the same as the return value of this function in the case that `obj` is not `undefined` or `null`.  All keys that are found and successfully deleted will be returned within an object.

parts.name: dice
parts.description: Dices up a string splitting it on the passed in delimiter and placing the results in an array while making sure that the empty string is converted to an empty array.

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be diced and turned into an array of strings.

params.name: delim
params.description: The regular expression or string to be used as a delimiter in order to dice up `str`. The matched substrings will not be included in the strings returned in the array.

params.name: opt_limit
params.description: If specified, this number represents the maximum number of times `str` will be split on `delim`. Unlike with `String.prototype.split()`, the remaining substring after this limit will simply be placed in the last element of the array.

return.description: Returns an array of substrings formed by dicing (splitting) up `str` by `delim`. If `str` is an empty string, an empty array will be returned.

parts.name: diffArrays
parts.description: Creates a new array which is the difference of the two given arrays.

params.name: array1
params.description: Array containing the values that will be returned if they are not found in `array2`.

params.name: array2
params.description: Array whose values will be compared to those in `array1` and only those that appear in `array1` and not in this array will be returned.

return.description: A new array with values from `array1` that are not in `array2`.

parts.name: diffDates
parts.description: Finds the differents between 2 dates.

params.name: dEnd
params.description: Ending date.

params.name: dStart
params.description: Starting date.

params.name: opt_onlyRemainder
params.description: Determines whether or not the values returned will show the remainder values instead of the full values for each unit of measure.

return.description: An object containing all of the following measurements in the corresponding object properties: `years`, `months`, `days`, `hours`, `minutes` and `seconds`.  If `opt_onlyRemainder` is specified as `true` all of the object's properties will not include the measures for the next highest unit of measure.  If `op_onlyRemainder` is supplied `weekDays` and `weeks` are added to this returned object.  If `opt_onlyRemainder` is not specified or is `false` all of the object's properties will individual calculations indicating the difference in time.

parts.name: divide
parts.description: Finds the quotient of two numbers.

params.name: number1
params.description: Number to be divided by `number2`.

params.name: number2
params.description: Number to divide by `number1`.

return.description: If `number1` and `number2` are given the quotient of the two will be returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one number and will return the number passed to the partial function divided by `number1`.

parts.name: doEvery
parts.description: Execute a function every so often.  Similar to `setTimeout`.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to be executed every so often.

params.name: msDelay
params.description: Number of milliseconds between calls to `fn`.

params.name: opt_args
params.description: Arguments to be passed to `fn` every time it is called.

params.name: opt_immediate
params.description: Specifies whether or not an immediate call should occur.

return.description: The `timeoutID` associated with the ongoing process of running this function.  To stop calling `fn` you can use `clearInterval(timeoutID)`.

parts.name: dom
parts.description: Creates HTML DOM objects.

params.name: input
params.description: The value that will be converted to DOM objects.  If a string, it will be interpreted as raw HTML.  Otherwise this must be an object specifying at least the `nodeName` (or `_`) property.  To represent an element with child nodes you can set the `children` (or `$`) property to an `input` object, `input` string, or array of `input` strings and/or objects that will be recursively interpreted.  The `html` property will be interpreted as the `innerHTML` property.  The `text` property will be interpreted ass the `innerText` and `textContent` properties.  The `cls` property will be interpreted as the element's class name.

return.description: If `input` was a string an array of nodes represented in that string will be returned.  Otherwise the element represented by `input` will be returned.

parts.name: endsWith
parts.description: Determines whether a string ends with the characters of a specified string.

params.name: string
params.description: The string that will be searched.

params.name: target
params.description: The characters to be searched for at the end of `string`.

params.name: opt_length
params.description: If provided it is used as the length of `string`. If omitted, the default value is the length of `string`.

return.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not `target` is found at the end of `string`.

parts.name: entries
parts.description: Gets an array of pairs (array of length 2) indicating all of the keys and values within a given array or object.

params.name: value
params.description: Value for which you would like the property names retrieved.

params.name: opt_onlyNonEnums
params.description: If specified and is not `null` or `undefined` but is `false`-ish, all of the property key/value pairs (enumerable or not) will be returned.  If this is `true`-ish only the non-enumerable property key/value pairs will be returned.  If this is not given or is `null` or `undefined` all of the enumerable property key/value pairs will be returned.

return.description: An array of pairs (arrays where the first item is the key and the second is the value).

parts.name: eq
parts.description: Determines if one value is equal to (`==`) another value.

params.name: value1
params.description: Value to be checked to see if it is equal to (`==`) `value2`.

params.name: value2
params.description: Value to be checked to see if it is equal to (`==`) `value1`.

return.description: If `value1` and `value2` are given a boolean indicating if `value1` is equal to (`==`) `value2` will be returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one value and will return a boolean indicating if that value is equal to (`==`) `value1`.

parts.name: eqs
parts.description: Determines if one value is strictly equal to (`===`) another value.

params.name: value1
params.description: Value to be checked to see if it is strictly equal to (`===`) `value2`.

params.name: value2
params.description: Value to be checked to see if it is strictly equal to (`===`) `value1`.

return.description: If `value1` and `value2` are given a boolean indicating if `value1` is strictly equal to (`===`) `value2` will be returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one value and will return a boolean indicating if that value is strictly equal to (`===`) `value1`.

parts.name: escape
parts.description: Encodes a string to be used in a query part of a URL.

params.name: str
params.description: String to encode.

return.description: Encoded string that can be used in the query part of a URL.

parts.name: exec
parts.code: function exec(fn, opt_this) { return fn.apply(opt_this, slice(arguments, 2)), fn; }
parts.description: Calls a function and returns it so it can be called again.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to be called and returned.  The return value of this function will be ignored when it is called.

params.name: opt_this
params.description: Value referenced by `this` in evaluation of `fn`.

params.name: opt_args
params.description: Zero or more arguments to be passed to `fn`.

return.description: After executing `fn` it will be returned.

parts.name: execAll
parts.description: Gets all of the matches found when matching a regular expression against a string.

params.name: rgx
params.description: Regular expression to match against `str`.

params.name: str
params.description: String against which the regular expression should be matched.

params.name: opt_fnMapper
params.description: If specified the return value of this function will always be appended to the array which will be returned by `matchAll()` unless `undefined` is the return value.  The 1st argument passed will be an array representing the matches array that was found.  The 2nd argument passed will be the amount of times this mapper has been called.

return.description: If `rgx` matched a substring in `str` at least once and `opt_fnMapper` wasn't used, an array of all of the matches will be returned. Each match will at least have `match[0]`, `match.index` (the starting index of the found match within `str`), `match.source` (`rgx`) and `match.input` (`str`). If capture groups were specified in `rgx`, each will be found in its corresponding index starting with `match[1]`. If no matches were found, `null` is returned.

parts.name: expandRegExp
parts.description: Expands regular expressions by expanding the character classes.  Supports `[:alnum:]`, `[:alpha:]`, `[:digit:]`, `[:punct:]`, `[:space:]`, or `[:xdigit:]` and allows for addition of other character classes.

params.name: rgxOrCharClsName
params.description: Regular expression or name of the character class to add to future regular expressions passed to this function.

params.name: opt_charClass
params.description: If `rgxOrCharClsName` is a string this should be defined and should be the definition of the character class without brackets.  This character class will be added and will be used to expand future regular expressions passed into this function.

return.description: If `rgxOrCharClsName` is a regular expression this will be a modified version of it with the character classes expanded, otherwise this will be a boolean value indicating if the character class was successfully added.

parts.name: extend
parts.description: Adds extra properties to an object based on the properties owned by other specified objects.

params.name: objToExtend
params.description: Object to be modified.

params.name: objPropsX
params.description: One or more arguments where each one's properties will be added to `objToExtend`.

return.description: A reference to `objToExtend`.

parts.name: fill
parts.description: Fill an array with a given value.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array to fill.

params.name: value
params.description: Value with which to fill `arr`.

params.name: opt_start
params.description: Starting position within `arr` at which to fill `arr`.  If it is negative it will be calculated from the end of `arr`.

params.name: opt_end
params.description: Ending position within `arr` at which to no longer fill `arr`.  If it is negative it will be calculated from the end of `arr`.

return.description: A reference to `arr`.

parts.name: filterByProp
parts.description: Looks for all of the items in an array whose given property matches the criteria.

params.name: array
params.description: Array to traverse.

params.name: propName
params.description: Name of the property of each `array` item to inspect.  If no such property exists for any `array` item that item will simply be skipped.

params.name: tester
params.description: Criteria by which to test the property of each item in `array`.  If this is a function it will be passed the value of the property and the return value will be coerced to a boolean to see if the property fits the criteria.  If this is a regular expression it will be tested against the property to see if the property fits the criteria.  Any other type of value will be checked to see if the property is this value to see if it fits the criteria.

return.description: An array of the items in `array` for which `tester` matches the specified property.

parts.name: findByProp
parts.description: Looks for the first value in an array whose given property matches the criteria.

params.name: array
params.description: Array to traverse.

params.name: propName
params.description: Name of the property of each `array` item to inspect.  If no such property exists for any `array` item that item will simply be skipped.

params.name: tester
params.description: Criteria by which to test the property of each item in `array`.  If this is a function it will be passed the value of the property and the return value will be coerced to a boolean to see if the property fits the criteria.  If this is a regular expression it will be tested against the property to see if the property fits the criteria.  Any other type of value will be checked to see if the property is this value to see if it fits the criteria.

return.description: The first item in `array` for which `tester` matches the specified property.  If `tester` never matches any of the properties `undefined` will be returned.

parts.name: findIndexByProp
parts.description: Looks for the first index in an array whose given property matches the criteria.

params.name: array
params.description: Array to traverse.

params.name: propName
params.description: Name of the property of each `array` item to inspect.  If no such property exists for any `array` item that item will simply be skipped.

params.name: tester
params.description: Criteria by which to test the property of each item in `array`.  If this is a function it will be passed the value of the property and the return value will be coerced to a boolean to see if the property fits the criteria.  If this is a regular expression it will be tested against the property to see if the property fits the criteria.  Any other type of value will be checked to see if the property is this value to see if it fits the criteria.

return.description: The first index in `array` for which `tester` matches the specified property.  If `tester` never matches any of the properties `-1` will be returned.

parts.name: findNth
parts.code: eval('var findNthIndex,findNth;(function(z,y){=function(b,c,e){var f=0>e,h="RegExp"===typeOf(c);var a="String"===typeOf(b);h&&(c=new RegExp(c.source,(c+"g").match(/\\w*$/)[0].replace(a?/g(.)/:/g()/g,"$1")));if(a){var g=[];b.replace(c,function(a){g.push(a)});var d=g.length;a=f?d+e:e;if(0<=a&&a<d)return g[a]}else{!f&&++e;var k=f?-1:1;d=b.length;for(a=f?d-1:0;f?0<=a:a<d;a+=k)if(has(b,a)&&(h?c.test(b[a]):c(b[a]))&&!(e-=k))return b[a]}};})'.replace(/=.+;/, 'findNthIndex$&findNth$&').replace('push(a)', 'push(arguments[arguments.length-2])').replace(/(return )b.a./, '$1a'))(typeOf, has);
parts.description: Gets the nth value matching `target` in `subject`.

params.name: subject
params.description: Array or string to search for `target` in.

params.name: target
params.description: If `subject` is an array this must either be a function or a regular expression which will be tested against each element in `subject`.  If `subject` is a string this must be a regular expression which will be tested against it to find all of the matches.

params.name: n
params.description: The number of the occurrence that will be searched for and returned.  `0` represents the first occurrence whereas `-1` represents the last.

return.description: The nth occurrence of `target` within `subject`.  If not found `undefined` will be returned.

parts.name: findNthIndex
parts.description: Get the nth index of the `target` in `subject`.

params.name: subject
params.description: Array or string to search for `target` in.

params.name: target
params.description: If `subject` is an array this must either be a function or a regular expression which will be tested against each element in `subject`. If `subject` is a string this must be a regular expression which will be tested against it to find all of the matches.

params.name: n
params.description: The number of the occurrence that will be searched for and returned.  `0` represents the first occurrence whereas `-1` represents the last.

return.description: If the nth occurrence of `target` can be found within `subject` the index will be returned otherwise `undefined` will be returned.

parts.name: first
parts.code: var first = nth(0);
parts.description: Gets the last element in an array or an array-like object.

params.name: array
params.description: The array or array-like object from which to pull the first element.

return.description: The first value of `array`.

parts.name: flatMap
parts.description: Iterates through each item in an array or an object, passing the item to a mapping function, and flattens the result into the array or object.

params.name: arrOrObj
params.description: Array or object whose items should be iterated through and passed to the mapping function.

params.name: mapper
params.description: Mapping function which will be passed (1) the item be analyzed, (2) the corresponding index or key for said item, and (3) a reference to `arrOrObj`.  The return value will be flattened into the array or object returned from `flatMap()`.

params.name: opt_thisArg
params.description: The value that will be referenced when using the `this` keyword within `mapper`.  If not given this will refer to the global object.

return.description: If `arrOrObj` was an array then an array will be returned, otherwise an object will be returned.  If an array, the values returned from `mapper` for each item will occupy the position of the original item in this new array.  If an object, the values returned from `mapper` will be used instead of the items that were passed in and the new object will use the key(s) from the objects returned for this new object.

tests.name: Simple Array
Simple Object

parts.name: flatten
parts.description: Create a flattened copy of an array.

params.name: array
params.description: Array to flatten.

params.name: opt_depth
params.description: If `true` or `Infinity` there will be no limit to the recursiveness of the flattening.  Otherwise, if given, this should be a number indicated how many levels down this array should be flattened.

return.description: Flattened version of `array` up to the given `opt_depth`.

parts.name: floor
parts.description: Rounds towards `-Infinity` with the specified precision.

params.name: num
params.description: The number to be rounded towards `Infinity`.

params.name: opt_precision
params.description: The precision (as an integer) with which to round the number towards `-Infinity`. Using the precision is similar to doing `Math.floor(num * Math.pow(10, precision)) / Math.pow(10, precision)`.

return.description: Returns `num` rounded towards `-Infinity` with the specified precision.

parts.name: forEach
parts.description: Traverses all the characters in a string or all of the elements in an array or an array-like object, executing a function on each one.

params.name: a
params.description: Array or array-like object or string to traverse.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function called on each item in `a`.  The parameters passed are as follows:  (1) value, (2) key, (3) `a` and (4) ender function.  The `this` keyword will contain the number of times the function has been called.  The ender function may be used to immediately stop traversing `a`.  Calling the ender function with a `true`-ish value will instead make the ender function return a boolean value indicating if the ender function has already been called (useful only in a `catch` or `finally` clause).

params.name: opt_traverseAll
params.description: Boolean indicating if all items in `a`, including those not owned by `a`, should be traversed.

return.description: The number of times `fn` was called.

parts.name: forIn
parts.description: Runs through all of the properties of an object, executing a function for each property found.

params.name: obj
params.description: Object whose properties will be traversed.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to call for each property in `obj`.  The parameters passed are as follows:  (1) value, (2) key, (3) `obj` and (4) ender function.  The `this` keyword will contain the number of times the function has been called.  The ender function may be used to immediately stop traversing `obj`.  Calling the ender function with a `true`-ish value will instead make the ender function return a boolean value indicating if the ender function has already been called (useful only in a `catch` or `finally` clause).

params.name: opt_traverseAll
params.description: Boolean indicating whether or not even the properties that are not owned by `obj` should be traversed.  If `true` all properties will be traversed.

return.description: Number of times `fn` was called.

parts.name: formatDate
parts.description: Creates a string representation of the date using the specified format string.

params.name: date
params.description: Date object to be formatted as a string.

params.name: strFormat
params.description: If part of the string is wrapped in single quotes, those single quotes will be removed, any groupings of 2 consecutive single quotes will be replaced with just one and the other characters will appear in the returned string as is.  `YYYY` will be replaced by the full year (eg. 2018).  `YY` will be replaced by a 2-digit representation of the year (eg. 18).  `MMMM` will be replaced by the name of the month (eg. September).  `MMM` will be replaced by the 1st 3 characters of the name of the month (eg. Sep).  `MM` will be replaced by a 2-digit representation of the month (eg. 09).  `M` will be replaced by a numeric representation of the month (eg. 9).  `DDDD` will be replaced by the name of the day of the week (eg. Sunday).  `DDD` will be replaced by the 1st 3 characters of the name of the day of the week (eg. Sun).  `DD` will be replaced by a 2-digit representation of the day of the month (eg. 02).  `D` will be replaced by a numeric representation of the day of the month (eg. 2).  `HH` will be replaced with a 24-hour 2-digit representation of the hour (eg. 15).  `H` will be replaced with a 24-hour numeric representation of the hour (eg. 15).  `hh` will be replaced with a 12-hour 2-digit representation of the hour (eg. 03).  `h` will be replaced with a 12-hour numeric representation of the hour (eg. 3).  `mm` will be replaced with a 2-digit representation of the minutes (eg. 26).  `m` will be replaced with a numeric representation of the minutes (eg. 26).  `ss` will be replaced with a 2-digit representation of the seconds (eg. 01).  `s` will be replaced with a numeric representation of the seconds (eg. 1).  `A` will be replaced with "AM" or "PM".  `a` will be replaced with "am" or "pm".  `SSS` will be replaced with a 3-digit representation of the milliseconds (eg. 000).  `S` will be replaced with a numeric representation of the milliseconds (eg. 0).  `Z` will be replaced with a representation of the timezone offset that starts off with "+" or "-", followed by 2 digits that represent the hours offset, followed by 2 digits that represent the minutes offset.

params.name: opt_overrides
params.description: Object that can override the preset values.  If the `months` property is defined it should be an array of 12 month names starting with January.  If the `days` property is defined it should be an array of the 7 days of the week starting with Sunday.

return.description: A string representation of `date` where all of the rules for `strFormat` are followed.

parts.name: formatTime
parts.description: Formats the time (number of milliseconds) given based on a format string.

params.name: ms
params.description: Number of milliseconds that will be represented in the returned string.

params.name: format
params.description: Format string where `W` (or `w`) will be replaced by the number of weeks, `D` (or `d`) by the number of days (maximum being 6), `H` (or `h`) by the number of hours (maximum being 23), `m` by the number of minutes (maximum being 59), `s` by the number of seconds (maximum being 59), and `S` by the number of milliseconds (maximum being 999).  Adding an exclamation point to the end of any of those characters (eg. `S!`) will result in the corresponding value not being truncated based on the next highest time increment.  Using `HH`, `hh`, `mm`, `ss` or `SSS` will result in leading zeroes for those corresponding values.  Instances of `-` will be removed only if `ms` is positive.  Instances of `+` will be replaced with `-` only if `ms` is negative, otherwise `+` will remain.  Wrapping a substring in single quotes or double quotes will cause that substring to be escaped and any instances of that same quote character being repeated once will be replaced with just one.

return.description: The value of `ms` formatted based on `format`.

parts.name: forOf
parts.description: Traverses all the characters in a string or all of the items in an array or an object, executing a function on each one.

params.name: obj
params.description: If is an array, an array-like object, or an object, its items will be traversed.  If it is a string its characters will be individual traversed.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to call for each item traversed within `obj`.  The parameters passed are as follows:  (1) value, (2) key, (3) `obj` and (4) ender function.  The `this` keyword will contain the number of times this `fn` function has been called.  The ender function may be used to immediately stop traversing `obj`.  Calling the ender function with a `true`-ish value will instead make the ender function return a boolean value indicating if the ender function has already been called (useful only in a `catch` or `finally` clause).

params.name: opt_traverseAll
params.description: Boolean indicating whether or not even the properties that are not owned by `obj` should be traversed.  If `true` all properties will be traversed.

return.description: Number of times `fn` was called.

parts.name: frac
parts.description: Gets the fractional part of a number, removing the integral part.

params.name: num
params.description: The number from which the fractional part will be pulled.

return.description: Returns `num` without the integral part while keeping the sign.

parts.name: fround
parts.description: Gets the nearest 32-bit single precision float representation of a number.

params.name: doubleFloat
params.description: A Number. If the parameter is of a different type, it will get converted to a number or to `NaN` if it cannot be converted.

return.description: The nearest 32-bit single precision float representation of the given number.

parts.name: fullNumber
parts.description: Takes a number in any form and returns it as a string in its fullest form (removing exponents).

params.name: num
params.description: Number to return in its fullest form.

return.description: If `num` is a finite number it will be returned as a number in its fullest form without exponents of any kind.  If `num` is not a finite number `undefined` will be returned.

parts.name: gcd
parts.description: Finds the largest integer which evenly divides the two specified integers.

params.name: int1
params.description: The first of two integers for which the greatest common denominator should be found.

params.name: int2
params.description: The second of two integers for which the greatest common denominator should be found.

return.description: Returns the largest integer which evenly divides `int1` and `int2`.

parts.name: get
parts.description: Get the value of the specified property name.

params.name: obj
params.description: Object to get the property from.

params.name: opt_name
params.description: Name of the property.

params.name: opt_default
params.description: The default value to return if the specified property (`opt_name`) is not owned by `obj`.

return.description: If both `obj` and `opt_name` are specified then either the owned property will be returned or `opt_default` will be returned.  If `obj` is `undefined` a partial function will be returned that will accept an object to always pull the same property name (`opt_name`) from and an optional different default value. If `name` is of type `RegExp` an object containing all of the cookies with names that match the specified regular expression will be returned.  If `name` is `undefined` or `null` an object containing all of the cookies will be returned.  If an object is returned each key will represent the name of each cookie and each value will be the value of that cookie.

        .replace(/`/g, '!(I(b,a)>=0)') // ifIn() && ifOut
        .replace(/_/g, '!(I(a,b)>=0)') // ifIncludes() && ifExcludes()
        .replace(/#/g, '~b`b.test(a):b(a))') // ifPass() && ifFail()
        .replace(/%/g, '~a`a.test(b):a(b))') // ifPasses() && ifFails()
        .replace(/~(.)`/g, '!(O.toString.call($1)==="[object RegExp]"?') // Fix ifPass(), ifPasses(), ifFail() & ifFails()
        .replace(/!([^!]+(!|$))/g, ' $1')
        .replace(/@/g, 'a!==a?b!==b:a===0?1/a===1/b:a===b') // Fix ifIs() & ifNot() (including NaNs and 0s)
        .replace(/,(.+)/, 'return[$1]')

    ifNot = ifIs[1],
    ifIn = ifIs[2],
    ifOut = ifIs[3],
    ifIncludes = ifIs[4],
    ifExcludes = ifIs[5],
    ifPass = ifIs[6],
    ifFail = ifIs[7],
    ifPasses = ifIs[8],
    ifFails = ifIs[9];

tests.code:
test([
  YourJS.indexOfDiff('', ''),  // -> -1
  YourJS.indexOfDiff('Cool', 'Cool'),  // -> -1
  YourJS.indexOfDiff('Cool beans', 'Cool'),  // -> 4
  YourJS.indexOfDiff('Cool beans', 'Cool jeans'),  // -> 5
  YourJS.indexOfDiff(Math.PI + '', '3.14159')  // -> 7
