parts.name: isFinite
parts.description: Tests a value to see if it is a number that is also finite.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to be tested to see if it is a number and is finite.

return.description: `true` if `value` is a number and is finite, otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isFloat
parts.description: Determines if a value is a floating point number.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to be tested.

return.description: `true` if `value` is a floating point number, otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isFullOf
parts.description: Determines if an array, array-like object, or an object is full of items that match a specific type or tester function.

params.name: arrOrObj
params.description: Array, array-like object, or object whose items will be tested.

params.name: tester
params.description: If a string is specified it will be assumed to be the type that all values in `arrOrObj` must match.  Otherwise this must be a function that will accept (1) the item value, (2) the item index, and (3) a reference to `arrOrObj` and the return value of this function will coerced to a boolean to determine if the value matched.

params.name: opt_trueOnEmpty
params.description: Indicates whether or not an empty `arrOrObj` will allow this call to `isFullOf()` to evaluate to `true`.

return.description: `true` if all of the items in `arrOrObj` match `tester` or if `arrOrObj` is empty and `opt_trueOnEmpty` is `true`-ish.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isFunction
parts.description: Determines if the given value is of type `Function` as specified by `typeOf()`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to see if it is of type `Function` according to `typeOf()`.

return.description: `true` if `value` is of type `Function` according to `typeOf()`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isInRange
parts.description: Determines if a value is within a given range.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to be checked.

params.name: lowerBounds
params.description: Lower bounds against which `value` will be checked.

params.name: upperBounds
params.description: Upper bounds against which `value` will be checked.

params.name: opt_excludeBounds
params.description: Indicates whether or not equality to the bounds should prevent the `value` from being considered within the range.

return.description: `true` if `value` is greater than or equal `lowerBound` and less than or equal `upperBound` (equality test is ignored if `opt_excludeBounds` is `true`-ish), otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isInt
parts.description: Determines if a value is an integer.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to be tested.

return.description: `true` if `value` is an integer, otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isKind
parts.description: Checks to see if a value is of a specific kind.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to determine if it matches any of the type names given.

params.name: kindName
params.description: Possible kind names to match `value` against.

return.description: A boolean indicating if the kinds of `value` matched against any of the `kindName` arguments passed.

parts.name: isKindFor
parts.description: Creates a partial isKind() function.

params.name: kindName
params.description: One or more kind names to check against values.

params.name: opt_negate
params.description: If specified the returned function's return value will always be negated.

return.description: A function that can be used to see if any value passed to it is one of the kind names passed in as `kindName`. The return value will indicate if one of the kind names matches the kind of the value passed to it. If `opt_negate` is `true` the return value of this function will be the opposite.

parts.name: isLeapYear
parts.description: Determine if the specified year is a leap year.

params.name: opt_year
params.description: The year to be tested.  If a date is specified the year from that date will be used.  If nothing is specified the current year will be used.

return.description: `true` if `year` is a leap year, otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isLowerCase
parts.description: Determines if a string doesn't have upper cased characters.

params.name: str
params.description: The value to be checked.

params.name: opt_allowNoCasing
params.description: If `true`, characters without casing found in `str` will be viewed as lower cased characters.

return.description: `true` if `str` only has cased characters that are lower cased or if `opt_allowNoCasing` is `true` and `str` only has characters without casing. Otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isMixCase
parts.description: Determines if a string has both upper cased and lower cased characters.

params.name: str
params.description: The value to be checked.

params.name: opt_allowNoCasing
params.description: If `true`, characters without casing found in `str` will be viewed as mixed cased characters.

return.description: `true` if `str` has mixed cased characters or if `opt_allowNoCasing` is `true` and `str` only has characters without casing. Otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isNaN
parts.description: Determines whether or not a value is actually `NaN`.  Different from the global `isNaN` function because it only tests for the presence of the `NaN` value.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to test to see if it is `NaN`.

return.description: If `value` is `NaN` then `true` is returned, otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isNegative
parts.description: Determines if a value is negative.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to test to see if it is negative.

params.name: opt_includeNegZero
params.description: Value indicating whether or not `-0` should be counted as negative.

return.description: `true` if `value` is negative or if `value` is `-0` and `opt_includeNegZero` is `true`-ish.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isNil
parts.description: Determines if a value is either `null` or `undefined`.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to be checked.

return.description: Returns `true` if value is either `null` or `undefined`. Otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isNoCase
parts.description: Determines if a string only has characters without casing.

params.name: str
params.description: The value to be checked.

return.description: `true` if `str` only has characters without casing. Otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isNot
parts.description: Tests to see if two or more values are not exactly the same. This is similar to `!==` but will also work with `NaN` and can differentiate between `-0` and `0`.

params.name: x
params.description: A value.

params.name: y
params.description: Value to be compared to `x` for inequality.

params.name: otherValues
params.description: Any additional values to be compared to `x` and `y`.

return.description: `true` if any of the parameters passed are not exactly the same, otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isNull
parts.description: Determines if the given value is `null` as specified by `typeOf()`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to see if it is `null` according to `typeOf()`.

return.description: `true` if `value` is `null` according to `typeOf()`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isNumber
parts.description: Determines if the given value is of type `Number` as specified by `typeOf()`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to see if it is of type `Number` according to `typeOf()`.

return.description: `true` if `value` is of type `Number` according to `typeOf()`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isNumeric
parts.description: Indicates if a value is a numeric string.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to test.

return.description: Boolean indicating whether or not `value` is a numeric string.

parts.name: isObject
parts.description: Determines if the given value is of type `Object` as specified by `typeOf()`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to see if it is of type `Object` according to `typeOf()`.

return.description: `true` if `value` is of type `Object` according to `typeOf()`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isoDate
parts.description: Gets the date in the ISO-8601 standard format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ`

params.name: opt_date
params.description: Date to convert to ISO-8601 format.  If not given the current date/time is used.

return.description: `opt_date` as a string in the ISO-8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ`

parts.name: isOf
parts.description: Creates functions for testing if a value "is" (or "is not") a value.

params.name: value
params.description: The value that the returned function will always be used to check against.

params.name: opt_negate
params.description: Determines if the returned function will always check if passed values are NOT `value`.

params.name: opt_traverseArray
params.description: If `value` is an array, the returned function will check the passed value against all of the items within `value`.

return.description: Function that accepts one argument which will be checked against `value`.  The function will return a boolean value when called indicating if it matches `value` or not (also depending on the value of `opt_negate`).

tests.name: Simple

parts.name: isPositive
parts.description: Determines if a value is positive.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to be tested as to whether or not it is positive.

params.name: opt_includeZero
params.description: Value indicating whether or not `0` should be counted as positive.

return.description: `true` if `value` is negative or if `value` is `-0` and `opt_includeNegZero` is `true`-ish.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isPrime
parts.description: Determines if a number is a prime integer.

params.name: num
params.description: Number to be tested.

return.description: `true` if `num` is a positive integer that is only divisible by itself and `1`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isPrimitive
parts.description: Determines if something is a primitive or not. If not a primitive it must be some form of object.

params.name: arg
params.description: The argument which will be determined as being either a primitive (eg. boolean, number, string, etc.) or a non-primitive.

return.description: `true` will be returned if `arg` is simply a primitive, otherwise `false` will be returned.

parts.name: isPrototype
parts.description: Determines if an object is a prototype object.

params.name: obj
params.description: Object to check to see if it is a prototype.

return.description: If `obj` is a prototype object `true` is returned, otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isRegExp
parts.description: Determines if the given value is of type `RegExp` as specified by `typeOf()`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to see if it is of type `RegExp` according to `typeOf()`.

return.description: `true` if `value` is of type `RegExp` according to `typeOf()`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isRegExpMatch
parts.description: Determine whether or not a RegExp matches an entire string (or the start of a string).

params.name: rgx
params.description: The regular expression to be used.

params.name: opt_str
params.description: If specified, `rgx` will be matched against the string to see if the regular expression matches from the beginning. If not specified, a function will be returned that will be used to match against `rgx` whenever it is called.

params.name: opt_onlyCheckStart
params.description: If `true`, `rgx` must only match the beginning of `opt_str`. If `false`, `rgx` must match the entire string `opt_str`.

return.description: If `opt_str` is given and is not `null` or `undefined`, a boolean will be returned. If `opt_onlyCheckStart` is `true`-ish the value returned will indicate if `rgx` simply matched from the beginning of `opt_str`. If `opt_onlyCheckStart` is `false`-ish, the value returned will indicate if `rgx` matched all of `opt_str`. If `opt_str` is not given or `null` or `undefined` a function to match against `rgx` will be returned which will accept a string as the 1st argument that will act as `opt_str` would have and a 2nd optional argument which will act as `opt_onlyCheckStart` would have and will return a boolean indicating if `rgx` matches `str`.

parts.name: isSafeInt
parts.description: Determines if the argument that is passed in is an integer in the range of `-9007199254740991` and `9007199254740991`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to test out.

return.description: Boolean indicating if `value` is an integer within the range of `-9007199254740991` and `9007199254740991`.

parts.name: isSpace
parts.code: var isSpace = isRegExpMatch(/[ \xA0\u1680\u180E\u2000-\u200A\u2028\u2029\u202F\u205F\u3000]/);
parts.description: Test for space characters starting at the beginning of a string.

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be tested.

params.name: opt_onlyCheckStart
params.description: If `true`, only the beginning of the string is checked to see if it starts with a space character. If `false`, all of the string is checked to see if it only contains space characters.

return.description: Returns `true` if `opt_onlyCheckStart` is `true`-ish and `str` starts with a space character or if `opt_onlyCheckStart` is `false`-ish and `str` only contains space characters. Otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isString
parts.description: Determines if the given value is of type `String` as specified by `typeOf()`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to see if it is of type `String` according to `typeOf()`.

return.description: `true` if `value` is of type `String` according to `typeOf()`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isType
parts.description: Determines if a value is of a specific type or one of a list of specific types.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to determine if it matches any of the type names given.

params.name: typeName
params.description: Possible type names to match `value` against.

return.description: A boolean indicating if the type of `value` matched against any of the `typeName` arguments passed.

parts.name: isTypeFor
parts.description: Creates a partial `isType()` function.

params.name: typeNames
params.description: One or more type names to check against values.

params.name: opt_negate
params.description: If specified the returned function's return value will always be negated.

return.description: A function that can be used to see if any value passed to it is one of the type names passed in as `typeNames`.  The return value will indicate if one of the type names matches the type of the value passed to it.  If `opt_negate` is `true` the return value of this function will be the opposite.

parts.name: isUndefined
parts.description: Determines if the given value is `undefined` as specified by `typeOf()`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to see if it is `undefined` according to `typeOf()`.

return.description: `true` if `value` is `undefined` according to `typeOf()`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isUnknown
parts.description: Determines if the given value is `Unknown` as specified by `typeOf()`.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to see if it is `Unknown` according to `typeOf()`.

return.description: `true` if `value` is `Unknown` according to `typeOf()`.  Otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isUpperCase
parts.description: Determines if a string doesn't have lower cased characters.

params.name: str
params.description: The value to be checked.

params.name: opt_allowNoCasing
params.description: If `true`, characters without casing found in `str` will be viewed as upper cased characters.

return.description: `true` if `str` only has cased characters that are upper cased or if `opt_allowNoCasing` is `true` and `str` only has characters without casing. Otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: isValidVarName
parts.description: Determines if a string can be used as a variable name in JavaScript.

params.name: varName
params.description: The string to be tested to see if it is a valid variable name.

return.description: `true` if the string value of `varName` is a valid variable name in JavaScript, otherwise `false`.

parts.name: isWhitespace
parts.code: var isWhitespace = isRegExpMatch(/[\t-\r\x1C- \u1680\u180E\u2000-\u200A\u2028\u2029\u205F\u3000]/);
parts.description: Test for whitespace characters starting at the beginning of a string.

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be tested.

params.name: opt_onlyCheckStart
params.description: If `true`, only the beginning of the string is checked to see if it starts with a whitespace character. If `false`, all of the string is checked to see if it only contains whitespace characters.

return.description: Returns `true` if `opt_onlyCheckStart` is `true`-ish and `str` starts with a whitespace character or `if opt_onlyCheckStart` is `false`-ish and `str` only contains whitespace characters. Otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: join
parts.description: Glues the values of an array together to form a string.

params.name: arr
params.description: The array containing the values to be glued together.

params.name: opt_delimiter
params.description: The string to delimit each value in `arr`.

params.name: opt_beforeEach
params.description: The string to prepend to each value in `arr`.

params.name: opt_afterEach
params.description: The string to append to each value in `arr`.

return.description: A string representation of `arr` with all of the values prefixed by `opt_beforeEach`, suffixed by `opt_afterEach` and separated by `opt_delimiter`.

parts.name: jsonp
parts.description: Adds a JSON-P script to the page to be executed once the script has been retrieved.

params.name: url
params.description: URL of the JSON-P script without the callback parameter provided.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function to be called by the JSON-P script.

params.name: opt_callbackParamName
params.description: Name of the parameter that will be passed the callback function's name.

return.description: The script element that is added to the page.

parts.name: keepAspectRatio
parts.description: Maximizes the dimensions while keeping the same aspect ratio.

params.name: width
params.description: The base width.

params.name: height
params.description: The base height.

params.name: tagetWidth
params.description: The target width.

params.name: targetHeight
params.description: The target height.

params.name: opt_maximize
params.description: If `false`-ish, the minimum dimensions will be found where at least one of the dimensions matches the corresponding target dimension. If `true`-ish, the maximum dimensions will be found where at least one of the dimensions matches the corresponding target dimension.

return.description: Object containing the minimum or maximum calculated width and height while keeping the same aspect ratio provided.  Eg. `{ height: 400, width: 320 }`.

parts.name: keys
parts.description: Gets the keys of a specified value.

params.name: value
params.description: Value for which you would like the property names retrieved.

params.name: opt_onlyNonEnums
params.description: If specified and is not `null` or `undefined` but is `false`-ish, all of the property names (enumerable or not) will be returned.  If this is `true`-ish only the non-enumerable property names will be returned.  If this is not given or is `null` or `undefined` all of the enumerable property names will be returned.

return.description: An array of all of the keys of `arrOrObj`.

tests.name: Simple Object Test

parts.name: keysMatch
parts.description: Tests two or more objects to make sure they have the same keys.

params.name: obj1
params.description: First object whose keys will be compared to the keys of the other objects passed in.

params.name: objX
params.description: The other objects whose keys will be compared to the keys of `obj1`.

return.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the keys of the objects that were passed in matched each other.

parts.name: kindsOf
parts.description: Retrieves all of the associated type names for a value.

params.name: value
params.description: Value for which to get all of the associated type names.

return.description: An array of all of the types that `value` is.

parts.name: last
parts.code: var last = nth(-1);
parts.description: Gets the last element in an array or an array-like object.

params.name: array
params.description: Array or array-like object from which to retrieve the last value.

return.description: The last value in `array`.

parts.name: lcm
parts.description: Finds the smallest integer that is evenly divisible by the two specified integers.

params.name: int1
params.description: The first of two integers that will be evenly divisible by the returned least common multiple.

params.name: int2
params.description: The second of two integers that will be evenly divisible by the returned least common multiple.

return.description: The smallest integer that is evenly divisible by `int1` and `int2`.

parts.name: limit
parts.description: Creates a wrapper function which when called will call the given function, but only a maximum amount of times as specified.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function which will only be called a limited amount of times.

params.name: opt_callLimit
params.description: The maximum amount of times the returned wrapper function can be called.

params.name: opt_errorMessage
params.description: If given, once the call limit is reached every subsequent call to the returned wrapper function will throw an error with this message.  If not given no error will be thrown.

return.description: A wrapper function that is limited in the amount of times it will call `fn`.

parts.name: log
parts.description: Gets the logarithm of any number in the specified base.  NOTE:  this function works best for values that don't rely on a base of `Math.E`.  If you want to find natural log it would be best to simply use `Math.log()`.

params.name: x
params.description: The number for which the logarithm will be calculated.

params.name: base
params.description: The base of the calculated logarithm.

return.description: The logarithm of `x` for the specified `base`.

parts.name: log10
parts.description: Gets the base 10 logarithm of a number.

params.name: x
params.description: A number.

return.description: The base 2 logarithm of the given number. If the number is negative, `NaN` is returned.

parts.name: log2
parts.code:
// Math.log2() and Math.log10() don't exist in IE.
eval('102'.replace(/..?/g, 'function log$&(x){return Math.log(x)*Math.LOG$&E}'));
parts.description: Gets the base 2 logarithm of a number.

params.name: x
params.description: A number.

return.description: The base 2 logarithm of the given number. If the number is negative, `NaN` is returned.

parts.name: loop
parts.description: Progressively loops the values within an array on each iteration while at the same time retrieving one of the end values of the specified array.

params.name: array
params.description: Array from which to pull the value which will also be modified because the value will then be placed on the opposite end.

params.name: opt_reverse
params.description: Boolean indicating that instead of retrieving the first value, the last value should be retrieved and then placed at the beginning of `array`.

return.description: If `opt_reverse` is `true`-ish the last value in `array` will be returned and also placed at the beginning of `array`.  Otherwise the first value in `array` will be returned and also placed at the end of `array`.

params.name: value

return.description: `value` coerced to a string with all of the characters lower-cased.

parts.name: lowerFirst

parts.description: Lower-cases the first character of a string.

params.name: string

return.description: `string` with the first character lower-cased and any remaining characters kept as is.

parts.name: lowerRest
parts.description: Lower-cases all characters after the first one.

params.name: string
params.description: String that should be returned making sure that all characters after the first are lower-cased.

return.description: `string` with the first character as is followed by all the rest lower-cased.

parts.description: Determines if one value is less than another value.

params.name: value1

params.name: value2
params.description: Value to be checked to see if it is less than `value1`.

return.description: If `value1` and `value2` are given a boolean indicating if `value1` is less than `value2` will be returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one value and will return a boolean indicating if that value is less than `value1`.

parts.name: lte
parts.description: Determines if one value is less than or equal to another value.

params.name: value1
params.description: Value to be checked to see if it is greater than or equal to `value2`.

params.name: value2
params.description: Value to be checked to see if it is less than or equal to `value1`.

return.description: If `value1` and `value2` are given a boolean indicating if `value1` is less than or equal to `value2` will be returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one value and will return a boolean indicating if that value is less than or equal to `value1`.

parts.name: matchAll
parts.code: eval('exec:a,ematch:e,a'.replace(/(\w+):(.,.)/g, 'function $1All($2,d){a=new RegExp(a.source,a.flags||(a+"").replace(/[^]+\\//,""));for(var b,f=0,c=[];b=a.exec(e);)d&&(b=d(b,++f)),void 0!==b&&c.push(b);return c.length?c:null}'));
parts.description: Gets all of the matches found when matching a regular expression against a string.

params.name: str
params.description: String against which the regular expression should be matched.

params.name: rgx
params.description: Regular expression to match against `str`.

params.name: opt_fnMapper
params.description: If specified the return value of this function will always be appended to the array which will be returned by `matchAll()` unless `undefined` is the return value.  The 1st argument passed will be an array representing the matches array that was found.  The 2nd argument passed will be the amount of times this mapper has been called.

return.description: If `rgx` matched a substring in `str` at least once and `opt_fnMapper` wasn't used, an array of all of the matches will be returned. Each match will at least have `match[0]`, `match.index` (the starting index of the found match within `str`), `match.source` (`rgx`) and `match.input` (`str`). If capture groups were specified in `rgx`, each will be found in its corresponding index starting with `match[1]`. If no matches were found, `null` is returned.

parts.name: max
parts.description: Get the (first) maximum value in an array.

params.name: array
params.description: Array which contains the maximum value that should be found.

return.description: The (first) maximum value within `array`.

parts.name: maxBy
parts.description: Get the (first) maximum value in an array determined by `valuer`.

params.name: array
params.description: Array which contains the maximum value that should be found.

params.name: valuer
params.description: If this is a function it will be passed each item in `array` and the corresponding values will be used to rank the items.  In all other cases this will be used as a path within each item in `array` whose property at that path will be used to rank the item.

return.description: The (first) maximum value within `array`.

parts.name: maxIndex
parts.description: Get the index of the (first) maximum value in an array.

params.name: array
params.description: Array which contains the maximum value that should be found and for which the corresponding index should be returned.

return.description: The index of the (first) maximum value within `array`.  If `array` is empty `-1` will be returned.

parts.name: maxIndexBy
parts.description: Get the index of the (first) maximum value in an array determined by `valuer`.

params.name: array
params.description: Array which contains the maximum value that should be found and for which the corresponding index should be returned.

parts.name: modRegExp
parts.description: Creates a new copy of a regular expression with modified flags.

params.name: rgx
params.description: The regular expression to be duplicated with modified flags.

params.name: modifiers
params.description: Specifies how to modify the flags of the duplicate of `rgx`. The standard flags are of course `g` for global, `i` for ignoreCase and `m` for multiline. In some environments other flags are also available. In order to assure that the duplicate will have specified flag you can just add the flag character (optionally you can prefix it with a `+`) to the string. In order to assure that the duplicate will exclude a specified flag you can enter - followed by the flag character in this string. In order to toggle the flag in the duplicate you can prefix the flag character with !. For example `"g-i!m"` (which is the same as `"+g-i!m"`) will ensure the `g` flag is included, ensure the `i` flag is excluded and toggle `m`.

return.description: Returns a duplicate of `rgx` with modified flags as specified by the `modifiers` string.

parts.name: modURL

If a function is given as a property name it will be executed and the return value will be used as that property of the URL.  Specifying an object for the `"search"` property will provide the ability to set individual search parameters.

If `opt_roundOut` is `false`-ish this will be a value that is either `target` or a little closer to `0` than `target`.

Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one value and will return a boolean indicating if that value is not equal to (`!=`) `value1`.

parts.name: now
parts.code:

now.valueOf = function() { return +new Date; };
parts.description: Gets the a `Date` object representing the current date/time.

params.name: opt_n
params.description: If given and `arrayOrN` is an array or an array-like object, this will be the position from which the value should be retrieved.  If this is a negative number the position will be calculated from the end of `arr`.  If `arrayOrN` is a number this will become that value.

parts.name: only

params.name: keys
params.description: If this is an array it must be the keys of the subject to be copied to the new object.  If this is a function it will be called for each key/value pair (receiving the key as argument 1 and the value as argument 2) and whenever the return value is `true`-ish the key/value pair will be copied to the new object.

params.name: opt_initial
params.description: If given this is the object that will be returned and into which the properties will be copied.

return.description: If `opt_subject` was given `opt_initial` with the specified keys copied into it will be returned. parts.name: partial

The arguments in `arrPresetArgs` will be sent as the left-most arguments if `opt_presetFromRight` is not specified or `false`-ish, otherwise they will be sent as the right-most arguments.

parts.name: partialAny

If a property is named `this` it will be used to specify the `this` context object of the partial function.

parts.name: poll

params.description: Polling function which will be executed every `opt_interval` until it returns a `true`-ish value or the `opt_timeout` time elapses.  The arguments passed will be (1) a prevention function that when called will prevent further tests from occurring and (2) the number of times this function was called.  Calling the prevention function will only prevent subsequent polls from happening, it will not indicate that the test was a success or failure.

params.name: fnOnFound
params.description: Function to execute once `fnTest` evaluates to a `true`-ish value.  The arguments passed will be (1) the return value from the success call to `fnTest` and (2) the number of times `fnTest` was called.

params.description: Amount of milliseconds to wait between tests.

params.description: Amount of milliseconds to wait timing out the poll.

return.description: Indicating if the first call to `fnTest` was a success.

If this is an object, the keys are interpreted as the keys and the values as values.  If the values are some type of object or array they will be JSON stringified.

parts.name: prefix

params.name: opt_rgxTester

If `opt_rgxTester` isn't given, the `str` will be returned and it will be prefixed with `strPrefix` if it isn't already at the beginning of it.  If `opt_rgxTester` is given and `str` tests negative against it `str` prefixed with `strPrefix` will be returned.  Otherwise `str` will be returned.

parts.name: quoteRegExp

If `flagsOrMakeRegExp` is a non-empty string, a regular expression with the specified characters representing the corresponding flags will be returned. parts.name: radians

params.name: degrees
params.description: The number representing degrees of an angle which will be converted to radians.

return.description: The equivalent of `degrees` in radians.

parts.name: random
parts.description: Either generates a random number or pulls a random value from an array.

params.name: arrOrMinOrMax
params.description: If an array, a random item from it will be returned.  If this is a number and `opt_max` is either not given or boolean this will be seen as the maximum value.  Otherwise this will be seen as the minimum value that can be returned.

params.name: opt_max
params.description: If this is a number it will be interpreted as the maximum value.  The maximum value will never be returned because a random number between the minimum value (inclusive) and the maximum value (exclusive) is always returned.  If this is a boolean it will be used as `opt_truncate` and the maximum will come from `arrOrMinOrMax` thus setting `0` to `arrOrMinOrMax`.

params.name: opt_truncate
params.description: If `true`-ish and `arrOrMinOrMax` wasn't an array the returned value will be truncated.

parts.name: range

params.name: opt_stop
params.description: The non-inclusive boundary of the range.  This value will not be included in the returned array.  The value is pulled from `startOrStop` if not specified.

params.name: opt_step
params.description: The difference between each subsequent number in the range.

return.description: Returns an array of all of the numbers in the range. If `opt_step` >= `0` but `startOrStop` >= `opt_stop`, an empty array will be returned. Also, if `opt_step` <= `0`, but `startOrStop` <= `opt_stop`, an empty array will be returned.

parts.name: rearg

params.name: opt_restIndex
params.description: The starting index of the rest of the arguments that will be allowed to be passed in after those specified by `indices`.  If `Infinity`, no more arguments will be passed no matter how many are sent to the wrapper function.  If `undefined`, `indices.length` will be used.

return.description: The wrapper function that will call `fn` with the arguments in the specified order.

parts.name: rem

parts.name: removeAt

parts.name: removeCookie
parts.description: Removes the specified cookie(s).

params.name: name
params.description: Either the name of the cookie to remove or a regular expression matching the names of all of the cookies to remove.  If `undefined` or `null` is supplied that means all cookies should be removed.

params.name: opt_options
params.description: Object whose property values can be used to specify additional options.  If you want to specify the hosts for which the cookie will be removed you can set the `domain` property.  If a domain is specified, subdomains are always included.  If you want to specify the URL path from under which the cookie will be removed you can specify it in the `path` property.  If you want to remove a secure cookie while on a secure site (`https:`) you can set the `secure` property to `true`.

return.description: If `name` is a string and matches the name of a cookie, that cookie's value will be returned as a string.  If `name` is a string but doesn't match the name of a cookie `undefined` will be returned.  If `name` is of type `RegExp` an object containing all of the cookies with names that match the specified regular expression will be returned.  If `name` is `undefined` or `null` an object containing all of the cookies will be returned.  If an object is returned each key will represent the name of each removed cookie and each value will be the value of that removed cookie.

parts.name: repair
parts.description: Creates a object where the keys and values are based on key/value pair returned by the specified pairing function.

params.name: obj
params.description: Object whose key/value pairs will be sent to the pairing function.

params.name: fnPairer
params.description: Pairing function that will take (1) an array containing each key/value pair within `obj` and (2) a reference to `obj`.  If something is returned that is not `undefined` or `null` it should be an array containing the key/value pair to add to `opt_initial`.

params.name: opt_initial
params.description: Object to return from `repair()` function which will contain the newly paired key/value pairs.  If not specified an empty object will be used.

return.description: A reference to `opt_initial` which has the key/value pairs returned by `fnPairer` added to it.

parts.name: repay
parts.description: Produces a function that when called will simply return what was passed in.

params.name: input
params.description: Zero or more arguments that will be returned by function made by this `repay` function.

return.description: A function that when called will return all `input` arguments originally passed to the `repay` function.  If only one `input` was passed, calling this returned function will simply return that one `input` argument.  In all other cases an array containing all `input` arguments will be returned when this returned function is called.

parts.name: repeat
parts.description: Creates a new string which is the given string repeated the specified number of times.

params.name: string
params.description: String to be repeated.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of times that `string` should be repeated.

return.description: A new string which will be `string` repeated `count` times.

parts.name: replace
parts.description: Replace targeted substrings with new strings.

params.name: subject
params.description: String to be modified and returned.

params.name: target
params.description: If this is a string each instance of this string will be found within `subject` and replaced by the result of `replacer`.  If this is an array each of the contents will be searched for within `subject` and replaced by the result of `replacer`.  If this is an object each key will be searched for and replaced by the result of the corresponding value.  If the corresponding value of an object's property is a function it will be executed the same way `replacer` would be.

params.name: replacer
params.description: If a function is supplied it will be called for each `target` found with argument 1 being the match array (including `match.input`, `match.index`, and `match.source`), argument 2 being the iteration count and argument 3 being a function that when executed will immediately stop replacing values.  If a string is supplied it will replace all instances of `target` within `subject`.  This parameter can be omitted and will be ignored if `target` is an object.

return.description: `subject` with all of the targeted substrings replaced with new strings as specified either by `target` or `replacer`.

parts.name: restParam
parts.description: Creates a wrapper function that if called with more arguments than specified, those arguments will be passed in as an array in the final argument.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to call with the normal parameters followed by the rest parameter in its place as specified by `opt_start`.

params.name: opt_start
params.description: The index within the arguments passed to the returned function that will start the summary of the rest parameter.

return.description: Returns a function that when invoked will call `fn`, but if there are any that have an index greater or equal to `opt_start` they will be passed in as the last parameter which will be an array.

parts.name: reverse
parts.description: Takes an array (or an array-like object) or a string, copies it, and returns the copy in reverse order.

params.name: arrOrStr
params.description: If this is an array or an array-like object a copy of it will be made as an array and then the copy will be reversed.  If this is a string a copy will be made with all of the characters put in reverse order.

return.description: Returns a copy of `arrOrStr` in reverse order.

parts.name: root
parts.description: Determines the nth-root of a number.

params.name: number
params.description: Number to be rooted.

params.name: n
params.description: The degree to which `number` should be rooted (eg. `3` for cube root).

return.description: `number` to the `n`th-root.

parts.name: round
parts.description: Rounds with the specified precision.

params.name: num
params.description: The number to be rounded.

params.name: opt_precision
params.description: The precision (as an integer) with which to round the number. Using the precision is similar to doing `Math.round(num * Math.pow(10, precision)) / Math.pow(10, precision)`.

return.description: Returns `num` rounded with the specified precision.

parts.name: roundIn
parts.description: Rounds a number towards `0`.

params.name: num
params.description: Number to round towards `0`.

params.name: opt_precision
params.description: The precision (as an integer) with which to round the number towards `0`.

return.description: `num` rounded towards `0`.

parts.name: roundOut
parts.description: Rounds a number towards `0`.

params.name: num
params.description: Number to round away from `0`.

params.name: opt_precision
params.description: The precision (as an integer) with which to round the number away from `0`.

return.description: `num` rounded away from `0`.

parts.name: sameSign
parts.description: Determines if two or more numbers have the same sign (negative or positive).

params.name: number1
params.description: First number to be compared to all of the other passed numbers.

params.name: number2
params.description: Second number to be compared to all of the other numbers passed.

params.name: numberX
params.description: All additional numbers, if any, to be compared to `number1`.

return.description: Returns `true` if all of the numbers are positive or all of them are negative, otherwise `false` is returned.

parts.name: sample
parts.description: Takes an array and returns a new array with some or all of the original values not usually in the same order.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array to create a new sample array from.

params.name: opt_count
params.description: Number of items to put in the sample array.  Cannot exceed `arr.length`.

return.description: Sample array of random elements picked from `arr`.

parts.name: sec
parts.description: Determines the secant of a given number either in radians or in degrees.

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle whose secant value should be returned.

params.name: opt_usingDegrees
params.description: If `true` then `angle` will be interpreted in degrees, otherwise `angle` will be interpreted in radians.

return.description: The secant of `angle` in radians by default, but if `opt_usingDegrees` is a `true`-ish value then the secant of `angle` in degrees will be returned.

parts.name: set
parts.description: Set the value of a property on an object.

params.name: obj
params.description: Object whose property will be set.

params.name: opt_name
params.description: Name of the property to be set.

params.name: opt_value
params.description: Value to which the property will be set.

return.description: If the first 3 arguments are given the previous property value will be returned unless `opt_returnObj` is `true`-ish in which case `obj` will be returned.  If one or more arguments are missing a partial function will be returned that will accept the remaining arguments.  The value of `opt_returnObj` will be ignored for partial functions.

parts.name: setAt
parts.description: Tries to set a value at the given `path` under the given `root` object.

params.name: root
params.description: Object to start at as the root of the proposed `path`.

params.name: path
params.description: An array of strings and/or numbers that represent the path to be traversed under `root`.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to be assigned under the specified `path` within the `root` object.

return.description: `true` if `value` is successfully set under the given path, otherwise `false`.

parts.name: setCookie
parts.description: Takes the name of a cookie and sets its value.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the cookie to set.

params.name: value
params.description: Value of the cookie to set.  If not a string, it will be coerced into a string.

params.name: opt_options
params.description: Object whose property values can be used to specify additional options.  If the cookie is meant to expire at a certain time you can set the `expires` property to a `Date` object or the number representation of such a date.  If you want to specify the maximum amount of seconds until the cookie expires you can set the `maxAge` (or `max-age`) property to the number of seconds.  If you want to specify the hosts to which the cookie will be sent you can set the `domain` property.  If a domain is specified, subdomains are always included.  If you want to specify the URL path that under which the cookie will be saved you can specify it in the `path` property.  If you want to set a secure cookie while on a secure site (`https:`) you can set the `secure` property to `true`.

return.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the cookie was set.

parts.name: shuffle
parts.description: Creates a new array with the items in a random order.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array to copy and shuffle.

return.description: Shuffled copy of `arr`.

parts.name: sin
parts.description: Determines the sine of a given number either in radians or in degrees.

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle whose sine value should be returned.

params.name: opt_usingDegrees
params.description: If `true` then `angle` will be interpreted in degrees, otherwise `angle` will be interpreted in radians.

return.description: The sine of `angle` in radians by default, but if `opt_usingDegrees` is a `true`-ish value then the sine of `angle` in degrees will be returned.

parts.name: slice
parts.code: var slice = alias(__EMPTY_ARRAY.slice, 'call');
parts.description: Slice does not modify the original array, but instead returns a shallow copy of elements from the original array.

params.name: array
params.description: Array or array-like object to shallow copy.

params.name: begin
params.description: Zero-based index at which to begin extraction.  A negative index can be used, indicating an offset from the end of the sequence. `slice(array,-2)` extracts the last two elements in the sequence.  If `begin` is `undefined`, slice begins from index `0`.

params.name: end
params.description: Zero-based index before which to end extraction. slice extracts up to but not including `end`.  For example, `slice(array,1,4)` extracts the second element through the fourth element (elements indexed 1, 2, and 3).  A negative index can be used, indicating an offset from the end of the sequence. `slice(array,2,-1)` extracts the third element through the second-to-last element in the sequence.  If `end` is omitted, `slice` extracts through the end of the sequence (`array.length`).  If `end` is greater than the length of the sequence, slice extracts through the end of the sequence (`array.length`).

return.description: A new array containing the extracted elements.

parts.name: sortBy
parts.description: Shallow copies and sorts an array given specific criteria.

params.name: array
params.description: Array to be sorted.

params.name: criteria
params.description: Criteria by which a shallow copy of `array` will be sorted.  If a string or an array is supplied it will be used as the path to each individual array element that will be keyed off of to do the sort.

params.name: opt_comparer
params.description: Comparison function used to compare each array element criteria.

return.description: A shallow copy of the array sorted according to the specified criteria and comparison function.

parts.name: span
parts.description: Creates an array with the span of numbers going from `first` and ending at `last` if possible depending on the specified step value.

params.name: first
params.description: First number to be processed for the returned array.

params.name: last
params.description: Last number to be processed for the returned array.

params.name: opt_step
params.description: Defaults to `1` if not given or if `0` or `NaN` is specified.  The difference between each subsequent number to be processed for the returned array.

params.name: opt_mapper
params.description: Function to call for each number in the sequence and whose return value will be used as the value added to the returned array.  If specified this function will be called for every number in the span, receiving it as the one and only argument.

return.description: An array containing the sequence of numbers starting at `first` and ending at `last`.  If `first` is less than `last` and `opt_step` is less than `0` or if `last` is less than `first` and `opt_step` is greater than `0` an empty array will be returned.  If `opt_mapper` is given the array will contain the sequence of mapped.

parts.name: splice
parts.description: Duplicates an array or a string and adds and/or removes one or more values from it. NOTE: This is different from the traditional splice function because it doesn't modify the array, but rather it returns a modified duplicate.

params.name: arrOrStr
params.description: The array or string to be duplicated and modified.

params.name: start
params.description: The position at which to start modifying `arrOrStr`. If this number is negative the position will be calculated from the end of `arrOrStr`.

params.name: opt_length
params.description: Indicates the amount of indices that should be removed from `arrOrStr`. If negative this will be used as if it were an index counting from the end of `arrOrStr`.

params.name: opt_replacement
params.description: If specified, this will be inserted at `start`. If `arrOrStr` is an array, this should be an array of the values to insert at `start`. If `arrOrStr` is a string, this should be the string to insert at `start`.

return.description: The modified duplicate of `arrOrStr`.

parts.name: spread
parts.description: Calls a function while flattening first-level array-like arguments so as the spread those individual values and use them as individual arguments.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to which the spread values will be passed.

params.name: args
params.description: Arguments that will be passed to `fn`.  If any of the arguments are arrays or array-like they will be flattened and passed to `fn` so as the spread those values.

return.description: Return value after calling `fn` with the specified `args`.

tests.name: Simple

parts.name: spreadNew
parts.description: Passes an array as the arguments to a construct thusly allowing a variable number of arguments to be passed to the constructor.

params.name: constructor
params.description: Constructor function to be called with a variable number of arguments.

params.name: args
params.description: Array or array-like object that will be treated as the arguments to pass to `constructor`.

return.description: Constructed object.

parts.name: startsWith
parts.description: Determines whether a string starts with the characters of a specified string.

params.name: string
params.description: The string that will be searched.

params.name: target
params.description: The characters to be searched for at the start of `string`.

params.name: opt_fromIndex
params.description: The position in `string` at which to begin searching for `target`.

return.description: A boolean indicating whether or not `target` is at the start of `string`.

parts.name: sub
parts.description: Substitute values into strings where the corresponding placeholders have been entered.

params.name: template
params.description: The string containing placeholders to be filled in and returned. A placeholder must correspond to a value in `opt_subs` and its name must be surrounded in curly braces (eg. `"Hello {name}!"` contains the `name` placeholder). If a placeholder refers to a number, a ternary operator can be used (eg. `"You have {apples} apple{apples?s:}"`). What appears between the `?` and the `:` will replace the placeholder if the variable before the `?` is not `1`. What appears after the `:` will replace the placeholder if the variable before the `?` is `1`. A 4-ary (AKA quaterary) operator can also be used if a placeholder refers to a number (eg. `"You have {apples?{apples}:one:no} apple{apples?s:}"`). When using a 4-ary operator, whatever appears after the second `:` will replace the placeholder if the variable before the `?` is `0`.  If a placeholder is not ternary or 4-ary but ends with `#`, `opt_funcs` will be called on the value and the return value will be used.  If a placeholder is not ternary or 4-ary but ends with `#` followed by a name (eg. `#ordinalize`), the function with that property name under `opt_funcs` will be called for the value and the return value will replace the placeholder.  If a placeholder evaluates to a function the function will be called all of the ternary or 4-ary values as arguments.  Nested expressions are supported.

params.name: opt_subs
params.description: Array or object from which to pull the values to be inserted into `template`.

params.name: opt_funcs
params.description: If this is a function it can be used to modify the values filled in within `template`.  If this is an object or an array its properties or array items can be referenced to modify the values filled in within `template`.

return.description: Returns `template` with all of the valid placeholders filled in with their substitutions as found in `opt_subs`.

parts.name: subtract
parts.description: Finds the difference of two numbers.

params.name: number1
params.description: Number to be subtracted from `number2`.

params.name: number2
params.description: Number to subtract from `number1`.

return.description: If `number1` and `number2` are given the difference of the two will be returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one number and will return the number passed to the partial function subtracted from `number1`.

parts.name: suffix
parts.description: Always ensures that a string ends with a specific substring.

params.name: str
params.description: This will be the string to which the suffix will be appended unless the test proves that it doesn't need to be appended.  Specifying `undefined` or `null` will cause a partial function to be returned.

params.name: strSuffix
params.description: This will be the suffix to add to `str` if it needs to be added.

params.name: opt_rgxTester
params.description: Regular expression to test against the string to be suffixed.  If the string tests negative against this regular expression `strSuffix` will be appended to the end of it.

return.description: If `str` is not given a partial function will be returned which will await the string value of `str`.  If `opt_rgxTester` isn't given, the `str` will be returned and it will be suffixed with `strSuffix` if it isn't already at the end of it.  If `opt_rgxTester` is given and `str` tests negative against it `str` suffixed with `strSuffix` will be returned.  Otherwise `str` will be returned.

tests.name: Simple
Partial
RegExp

parts.name: suffixFileSize
parts.description: Used to make a file size human readable.  Takes the number of bytes or bits and converts it into a string indicating the number in the appropriate range (eg. KB, MB, etc.).

params.name: count
params.description: Number of bytes or bits to represent as a string.

params.name: opt_countInBits
params.description: Specifies whether `count` is given in bits instead of bytes.

return.description: A string indicating `count` with the appropriate measure (eg. kb, Mb, etc.).

parts.name: sum
parts.description: Gets the sum of an array of numbers.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array of numbers to be summed up.

return.description: Sum of the array of numbers.

parts.name: swapProps
parts.description: Swaps the specified properties between the target object and the source object.

params.name: target
params.description: Target object from which the specified properties will be swapped.

params.name: source
params.description: Source object from which the specified properties will be swapped.

params.name: keys
params.description: Array of keys for the properties that should be swapped between `source` and `target`.

params.name: opt_dontDelete
params.description: Indicates whether properties that dont exist should be deleted between objects.  If `true`, non-existent properties will be set to `undefined`.

return.description: Returns a reference to `target`.

tests.name: Simple
Simple dont delete

parts.name: tan
parts.description: Determines the tangent of a given number either in radians or in degrees.

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle whose tangent value should be returned.

params.name: opt_usingDegrees
params.description: If `true` then `angle` will be interpreted in degrees, otherwise `angle` will be interpreted in radians.

return.description: The tangent of `angle` in radians by default, but if `opt_usingDegrees` is a `true`-ish value then the tangent of `angle` in degrees will be returned.

parts.name: testAt
parts.description: Tests a given `path` under the given `root` object and returns the values at each step of that `path`.

params.name: root
params.description: Object to start at as the root of the proposed `path`.

params.name: path
params.description: An array of strings and/or numbers that represent the path to be tested under `root`.

return.description: An array having a length less than or equal to that of `path` where each will be the value for the corresponding `path` value.

parts.name: throttle
parts.description: Creates a throttled version of a function which will only be executable once per every specified wait period.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function which will esentially be rate-limited.

params.name: msBetweenCalls
params.description: The amount of time to wait between calls.

params.name: opt_leading
params.description: Indicates whether or not the leading call or the trailing call should be executed. If `false` the trailing call will be made. If `true` the leading call will be made.

return.description: The throttled version of `fn` function.

parts.name: time
parts.description: Creates timed functions which on every successful execution will indicate the amount of time it took to execute.

params.name: func
params.description: Function to wrap and be timed.

params.name: times
params.description: If this is an array, on each successful execution of `func` an object will be added to the end containing the following properties:  `elapsed` (time taken), `start` (starting time stamp), `end` (ending time stamp), `returnValue`, `function` (a reference to `func`), `this` (context object passed to `func`), and `arguments` (those passed to `func`).  If this is a function, upon successful execution of `func` it will be called and passed the aforementioned object.

return.description: A wrapped version of `func` which will take the context and arguments and pass them to `func` and then return the return value from `func`.  All timing information will be given to `times`.

parts.name: timeAgo
parts.description: Gets a string indicating how long ago a given date was in the largest unit possible.

params.name: dateTime

params.name: opt_currDateTime
params.description: Current date.  If not given defaults to the current date and time.

return.description: A string indicating in the largest unit possible how long ago `dateTime` happened compared to `opt_currDateTime`.

tests.name: Simple
tests.code:
test(
  YourJS.timeAgo(new Date(2016,3,4), new Date(2017,1,2)),
  '10 months ago'
)

parts.name: titleCase

params.name: str
params.description: The string which will be title cased.

params.name: opt_fnFilter
params.description: If specified, this function will be passed every word (along with the position and the original string) and should return `true` if the word should be title cased, otherwise `false` should be returned.

return.description: `str` with all of the 1st letter of each word capitalized (unless filtered out by `opt_fnFilter`).

parts.name: toArray
parts.description: Turns anything into an array.

params.name: o
params.description: Any value to either convert to an array or wrap in an array.

return.description: If no arguments were passed an empty array is returned.  If the argument passed was array-like it will be returned as an `Array`.  Otherwise the argument passed will simply be returned within an array.

parts.name: toBase

params.name: base

Otherwise converts the first arguments to the specified `base` and returns the number as a string.

parts.name: toggle
parts.description: Toggles values in an array, adding the values that are missing from the array and removing those that are there.

params.name: opt_fnTestEquality

The first argument will be the value within `array` to be tested and the second will be the value within `valuesToToggle` to be tested.

return.description: A duplicate of `array` with the common values of `valuesToToggle` removed and the missing values added.

parts.name: trim

parts.name: trimLeft
parts.description: Removes all whitespace characters or the specified characters from the beginning of a string.

params.description: The string to return with all whitespace characters or specified characters stripped from the beginning of it.

params.name: opt_chars
params.description: Characters to remove from the beginning of the string.

params.description: The string to return with all whitespace characters or specified characters stripped from the end of it.

parts.name: trunc

parts.name: uint16

parts.name: uint32
parts.description: Takes a number and converts it to a 32-bit unsigned integer.

params.name: number
params.description: Number to be converted to a 32-bit unsigned integer.

return.description: Returns the specified number as a 32-bit unsigned integer.

parts.name: uint8
parts.description: Takes a number and converts it to a 8-bit unsigned integer.

params.name: number
params.description: Number to be converted to a 8-bit unsigned integer.

return.description: Returns the specified number as a 8-bit unsigned integer.

parts.name: unbind
parts.description: Unbinds a value from a function (such as a prototypal function) and creates a wrapper function that when called will use the 1st argument as the bound value.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to be unbound.

params.name: opt_args
params.description: Array of arguments to precede any additionally arguments passed to the returned wrapper function.

return.description: A wrapper function which when called will bound the first argument passed to it to `fn` and then pass the rest of the arguments in after any specified in `opt_args`.

parts.name: unescape
parts.description: Decodes any `%##` encoding in the given string. Plus symbols (`'+'`) are decoded to a space character.

params.name: str
params.description: String to be decoded.

return.description: Decoded version of `str`.

parts.name: uneval
parts.description: Creates a string representation of the given object or primitive.

params.name: subject
params.description: Object or primitive whose string interpretation will be formulated and returned.

params.name: opt_spaceCount
params.description: If given and not `0` this causes non-empty objects and/or arrays to be split onto multiple lines and indented by the amount of spaces given here.

return.description: A string representation of `subject`.

parts.name: unhashID
parts.description: Gets an ID (non-negative integer) by decoding the given hashed ID.

params.name: hashedID
params.description: The hashed ID that must be parsed to get the original ID.

params.name: opt_intHash
params.description: Non-negative integer that will be used to find the offset of the characters used to represent `hashedID`.

params.name: opt_strAlpha
params.description: All of the characters that were used to encode `hashedID`.  Defaults to the digits 0 to 9 followed by A to Z followed by a to z.

return.description: The ID (non-negative integer) that was used to produce `hashedID` based on the hash and the alphabet.

parts.name: union
parts.description: Creates a new array which will contain all of the items of the two given arrays.  Different from concatenation because the number of times a value occurs will never exceed the maximum number of times it was found in one of the arrays.

params.name: array1
params.description: First array to union with the second array.

params.name: array2
params.description: Second array to union with the first array.

return.description: An array of all of the items from `array1` and `array2` but limiting the occurrences to never exceeding the maximum number of times the value occurred in either array.

parts.name: uniquify
parts.description: Creates a new version of an array with all of the duplicate values removed.

params.name: array
params.description: Array to copy and then modify to get rid of all duplicates from within the copy.

return.description: A copy of `array` with all of the duplicates removed.

parts.name: untilExists
parts.description: Creates a copy of an array with all of the consecutive items up to but not including the first value `true`-ish value.

params.name: array
params.description: Array or array-like object containing values that will be copied.

params.name: opt_fromEnd
params.description: Indicates that the values should be copied starting from the end, not from the beginning as normal.

return.description: If `opt_fromEnd` is not given or is `false`-ish, an array of all of the consecutive `false`-ish values starting at the beginning of `array` will be returned.  Otherwise an array of all of the consecutive `false`-ish values starting at the end of `array` will be returned.

parts.name: upperCase
parts.description: Takes a value that will then be upper-cased.

params.name: value
params.description: The string or value to be upper-cased.

return.description: `value` coerced to a string with all of the characters upper-cased.

parts.name: upperFirst
parts.description: Upper-cases the first character of a string.

params.name: string
params.description: String that should be returned with the first character upper-cased.

return.description: `string` with the first character upper-cased and any remaining characters kept as is.

parts.name: upperRest
parts.description: Upper-cases all characters after the first one.

params.name: string
params.description: String that should be returned making sure that all characters after the first are upper-cased.

return.description: `string` with the first character as is followed by all the rest upper-cased.

parts.name: utc
parts.description: Creates a date using universal time.

params.name: yearOrValue
params.description: Either a `Date` object whose properties will be interpreted as UTC properties, or the number of milliseconds since the beginning of Jaunary 1, 1970 GMT, or a string version of the date, or the year.  If this is to be understood as the year additional arguments must also be passed.

params.name: opt_month
params.description: An integer between `0` and `11` representing the month.

params.name: opt_day
params.description: An integer between `1` and `31` representing the month.

params.name: opt_hour
params.description: An integer between `0` and `23` representing the hour.

params.name: opt_min
params.description: An integer between `0` and `59` representing the minute.

params.name: opt_sec
params.description: An integer between `0` and `59` representing the second.

params.name: opt_ms
params.description: An integer between `0` and `999` representing the millisecond.

return.description: Specified UTC date/time as a `Date` object.

parts.name: values
parts.description: Gets an array of all of the values within a given array or object.

params.name: value
params.description: Value for which you would like the property names retrieved.

params.name: opt_onlyNonEnums
params.description: If specified and is not `null` or `undefined` but is `false`-ish, all of the properties (enumerable or not) will be returned.  If this is `true`-ish only the non-enumerable properties will be returned.  If this is not given or is `null` or `undefined` all of the enumerable properties will be returned.

return.description: An array of all of the values in `value`.

parts.name: wait
parts.description: Creates a waiter function which takes orders and serves orders in a way and calls a ready function when all orders have been served.

params.name: fnReady
params.description: Function to be called when the waiter function is has been called to serve the last remaining order.  When called this function will receive all of the orders ever made as the 1st argument and the final order as the 2nd.

params.name: opt_clearOrdersAfterReady
params.description: If `true`-ish the orders array will be cleared after the `fnReady` function is called.  This prevents previous orders from showing up if `fnReady` is called multiple times.

return.description: A waiter function which take and serve orders.  The 1st argument passed to this function should be a boolean indicating that an order is going in.  The 2nd argument passed to this function can be any value that represents an order.  When this function is called a boolean will be returned indicating whether or not the call was successful.  The only way `false` can be returned by this function is if an order is to be served that doesn't exist.

parts.name: whileExists
parts.description: Creates a copy of an array with all of the consecutive items up to but not including the first value `false`-ish value.

params.name: array
params.description: Array or array-like object containing values that will be copied.

params.name: opt_fromEnd
params.description: Indicates that the values should be copied starting from the end, not from the beginning as normal.

return.description: If `opt_fromEnd` is not given or is `false`-ish, an array of all of the consecutive `true`-ish values starting at the beginning of `array` will be returned.  Otherwise an array of all of the consecutive `true`-ish values starting at the end of `array` will be returned.

parts.name: xorBits
parts.description: Finds the bitwise `xor` of two numbers.

params.name: number1
params.description: Number to be `xor`ed against `number2`.

params.name: number2
params.description: Number to be `xor`ed against `number1`.

return.description: If `number1` and `number2` are given a bitwise `xor` will be executed on both and returned.  Otherwise a partial function will be returned which when called will accept one number and will return a number which is the result of using bitwise `xor` on `number1` and the number passed to this partial function.

parts.name: zip
parts.description: Takes one or more arrays and does a kind of matrix inverse option on them.

params.name: array
params.description: One or more arrays whose array items will be used to create the returned array.

return.description: An array of arrays where the first array contains the first item of each array and the second array contains the second item of each array and so on.
